connector.description: Send and receive messages to/from Hazelcast distributed topic.

camel.sink.endpoint.defaultOperation.name: camel.sink.endpoint.defaultOperation
camel.sink.endpoint.defaultOperation.description: To specify a default operation to use, if no operation header has been provided. One of: [put] [delete] [get] [update] [query] [getAll] [clear] [putIfAbsent] [allAll] [removeAll] [retainAll] [evict] [evictAll] [valueCount] [containsKey] [containsValue] [keySet] [removevalue] [increment] [decrement] [setvalue] [destroy] [compareAndSet] [getAndAdd] [add] [offer] [peek] [poll] [remainingCapacity] [drainTo] [removeIf] [take] [publish] [readOnceHeal] [readOnceTail] [capacity]

camel.sink.endpoint.hazelcastInstance.name: camel.sink.endpoint.hazelcastInstance
camel.sink.endpoint.hazelcastInstance.description: The hazelcast instance reference which can be used for hazelcast endpoint.

camel.sink.endpoint.hazelcastInstanceNam.name: camel.sink.endpoint.hazelcastInstanceName
camel.sink.endpoint.hazelcastInstanceNam.description: The hazelcast instance reference name which can be used for hazelcast endpoint. If you don't specify the instance reference, camel use the default hazelcast instance from the camel-hazelcast instance.

camel.sink.endpoint.reliable.name: camel.sink.endpoint.reliable
camel.sink.endpoint.reliable.description: Define if the endpoint will use a reliable Topic struct or not.

camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer
camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.component.hazelcast-topic.lazyStar.name: camel.component.hazelcast-topic.lazyStartProducer
camel.component.hazelcast-topic.lazyStar.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.component.hazelcast-topic.autowire.name: camel.component.hazelcast-topic.autowiredEnabled
camel.component.hazelcast-topic.autowire.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

camel.component.hazelcast-topic.hazelcas.name: camel.component.hazelcast-topic.hazelcastInstance
camel.component.hazelcast-topic.hazelcas.description: The hazelcast instance reference which can be used for hazelcast endpoint. If you don't specify the instance reference, camel use the default hazelcast instance from the camel-hazelcast instance.

camel.component.hazelcast-topic.hazelcas.name: camel.component.hazelcast-topic.hazelcastMode
camel.component.hazelcast-topic.hazelcas.description: The hazelcast mode reference which kind of instance should be used. If you don't specify the mode, then the node mode will be the default.
